Add values to categorize

Source: R/emissions_profile_any_compute_profile_ranking.R
emissions_profile_any_compute_profile_ranking.Rd

Add values to categorize

Usage

emissions_profile_any_compute_profile_ranking(data)

Arguments

data

A "co2-like" data frame -- i.e. containing products or upstream-products (a.k.a. inputs).

Value

The input data frame with the additional columns grouped_by and profile_ranking and one row per benchmark per company.

See also

Other pre-processing helpers: sector_profile_any_pivot_type_sector_subsector(), sector_profile_any_prepare_scenario(), sector_profile_any_prune_companies()

Examples

library(tiltToyData)
library(readr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
options(readr.show_col_types = FALSE)

companies <- read_csv(toy_emissions_profile_any_companies())

products <- read_csv(toy_emissions_profile_products())
products |> emissions_profile_any_compute_profile_ranking()
#> # A tibble: 30 × 9
#>    grouped_by  profile_ranking co2_footprint tilt_sector    tilt_subsector unit 
#>    <chr>                 <dbl>         <dbl> <chr>          <chr>          <chr>
#>  1 all                     1          176.   Industry       Other          unit 
#>  2 all                     0.8         58.1  Industry       Other          unit 
#>  3 all                     0.4          4.95 Steel & Metals Steel          kg   
#>  4 all                     0.6         12.5  Agriculture    Agriculture    kg   
#>  5 all                     0.2          2.07 Industry       Other          kg   
#>  6 isic_4digit             1          176.   Industry       Other          unit 
#>  7 isic_4digit             0.5         58.1  Industry       Other          unit 
#>  8 isic_4digit             1            4.95 Steel & Metals Steel          kg   
#>  9 isic_4digit             1           12.5  Agriculture    Agriculture    kg   
#> 10 isic_4digit             1            2.07 Industry       Other          kg   
#> # ℹ 20 more rows
#> # ℹ 3 more variables: isic_4digit <dbl>, activity_uuid_product_uuid <chr>,
#> #   ei_activity_name <chr>

inputs <- read_csv(toy_emissions_profile_upstream_products())
inputs |> emissions_profile_any_compute_profile_ranking()
#> # A tibble: 198 × 9
#>    grouped_by profile_ranking input_co2_footprint input_tilt_sector
#>    <chr>                <dbl>               <dbl> <chr>            
#>  1 all                 0.909              7.07e+0 Inudstry         
#>  2 all                 1                  3.99e+1 Inudstry         
#>  3 all                 0.636              5.12e-1 Inudstry         
#>  4 all                 0.758              1.24e+0 Inudstry         
#>  5 all                 0.970              2.12e+1 Inudstry         
#>  6 all                 0.0909             1.24e-9 Inudstry         
#>  7 all                 0.121              7   e-9 Inudstry         
#>  8 all                 0.697              1.04e+0 Inudstry         
#>  9 all                 0.727              1.12e+0 Inudstry         
#> 10 all                 0.818              3.51e+0 Inudstry         
#> # ℹ 188 more rows
#> # ℹ 5 more variables: input_tilt_subsector <chr>, input_unit <chr>,
#> #   input_isic_4digit <dbl>, input_activity_uuid_product_uuid <chr>,
#> #   activity_uuid_product_uuid <chr>
